node.title: Australian baseball team to pay players and staff in Bitcoin
node.alt: Perth Heat general manager Steve Nelkovski holding a baseball bat while a ball is in mid-air.
node.description: The Perth Heat say they will accept Bitcoin as payment for merchandise and even ballpark concessions as they move away from dollars to cryptocurrency.
node.content: ["Australian Baseball League team the Perth Heat say they will become the first club in professional sport\u00a0to pay its players in Bitcoin as part of a new sponsorship agreement.", "The Heat will pay players and staff in Bitcoin,\u00a0as well as accept Bitcoin for sponsorships, merchandise and even famed ballpark concessions like peanuts and crackerjacks.", "The club has also appointed a chief Bitcoin officer to help move\u00a0\"the corporate treasury from dollars to Bitcoin\".", "\"This is not a one-off purchase to hedge against future uncertainties or inflationary pressures,\" Patrick O'Sullivan said in a team statement.", "\"The Perth Heat are embracing the reality that the future of money and corporate treasuries will live on the Bitcoin blockchain.\"", "Heat chief executive Steve Nelkovski spoke vaguely about the \"mindset that Bitcoin imparts\" and how that \"will be\u00a0felt by our players, coaches, staff, and our loyal fan base\".", "He said employees at the club \"fully embraced the opportunities\" that came with the move.", "\"By embracing the underlying values of the Bitcoin protocol we believe that the organisation can reach new levels of success both on and off the field and remind the world of the true value of sports,\" he said."]
